author: xtqqczze
body: Disable [SA1000](https://github.com/DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers/blob/master/documentation/SA1000.md) analyzer that was enabled in #13973 because the StyleCopAnalyzers version does not recognise target-typed new expressions.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
> I'm seeing warnings on the following pattern in live analysis, I'm surprised CI did not fail:
> 
> `SA1000: The keyword 'new' should be followed by a space.`
> 
> https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/db94377b3a69511280d329e64375475f6d7513b8/src/Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimCmdlets/RemoveCimInstanceCommand.cs#L288
> 
> This issue was fixed in DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers#3187, and is in the [v1.2.0-beta.261](https://github.com/DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers/releases/tag/1.2.0-beta.261) release.

_Originally posted by @xtqqczze in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/13973#issuecomment-735933117_

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
@iSazonov @adityapatwardhan SA1000 is now causing failures in CI:

https://dev.azure.com/powershell/PowerShell/_build/results?buildId=69096&view=results

title: Disable SA1000: Keywords should be spaced correctly
